spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vellynne is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Vellynne wears bracers of defense and carries a wand of magic missiles (see “Actions” below).

action.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and Vellynne regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. If Vellynne casts this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

action.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
entries: While holding this wand, Vellynne can expend 1 or more of its 7 charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. She can expend 1 charge to cast the 1st-level version of the spell. She can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge she expends. The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If the wand’s last charge is expended, roll a {@dice d20}; on a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: +1 Longsword, Ring of Free Action and a Potion of Greater Healing (see “Actions” below)

trait.name: Ring of Free Action
entries: While Kuiper wear this ring, difficult terrain doesn’t cost him extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce his speed nor cause him to be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Kuiper makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kuiper is an 6th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kuiper makes two longsword or shortbow attacks.

action.name: +1 Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Potion of Greater Healing (once)
entries: Kuiper regain 14 ({@dice 4d4 + 4}) hit points when you drink this potion. The potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.

trait.name: Pack Tactics. (Beast Form Only)
entries: Oleanne has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the her allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Oleanne is an 6th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Oleanne makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit ( {@hit 7} to hit with shillelagh) , reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, or  8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if shillelagh.

action.name: Bite. (Beast Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Oleanne can magically polymorphs into a beast form, almost always preferring a dire wolf, or back into her humanoid form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the beast form. She reverts to its humanoid form when she dies. Oleanna's statistics are the same in each form, except where noted in this stat block.

walk.condition: (fly 40 ft., swim 30 ft. in swam form)

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren’t silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shiraz the swanmay has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The shiraz the swanmay has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The shiraz the swanmay can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The swanmays’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The swanmay can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In swan form the Swanmay makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Longsword +2.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Short Bow.
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage

bonus.name: Shapechanger
entries: The swanmay can use its action to polymorph into a giant swan. Her statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When the Bloodskull Orc isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the Bloodskull Orc drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The Bloodskull Orc regains 5 hit points.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When the Bloodskull Orc isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the Bloodskull Orc drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: No!
entries: When an enemy within 5 feet of the rampart targets another creature with an attack, reduce the damage by {@dice 1d4 + 3}.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When the Bloodskull Orc isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the Bloodskull Orc  drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sounder Leader makes two Battle axe attacks or two Short Bow attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The Bloodskull Orc regains 10 hit points.

reaction.name: Sounder Leader's command
entries: When a creature the Bloodskull Orc can see within 30 feet of him fails an ability check or misses with an attack roll, that creature can reroll the check or attack, choosing either result.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Carlanis makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Carlanis has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Carlanis makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the Carlanis can't grab another creature.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) damage.

reaction.name: Meat Shield
entries: When the Carlanis is grappling a target and is hit by a ranged attack made by another creature he can see, the brawler gains a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this bonus causes the attack to miss the brawler, it hits the {@condition grappled} target instead.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When the bandit makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When the bandit makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Careful Withdraw
entries: The bandit archer can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Hand Axe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage in melee, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage at range.

reaction.name: Fleet Foot
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Frost Goblin Warrior misses them with a melee attack, the warrior can move up to half their speed.

bonus.name: Stealthy
entries: The goblin can take the Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The goblin doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The goblin doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when they move through or out of an enemy’s reach.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the Frost Goblin Fodder takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the lackey takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Tiny Cuts
entries: If an enemy starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more Frost Goblin Fodder who can see them, the enemy must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1 slashing damage for each Frost Goblin Fodder within 5 feet. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 + the number of Frost Goblin Fodders within 5 feet of the enemy.

action.name: Hand Axe (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The goblin doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when they move through or out of an enemy’s reach.

trait.name: Strong Grip
entries: Wielding a heavy weapon doesn’t impose disadvantage on the Frost Goblin Brute's attack rolls.

action.name: Great Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) damage.

reaction.name: Frenzied Warrior
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Frost Goblin Brute misses them with an attack, the Brute can make a melee attack against the creature with disadvantage.

monster.name: Frost Goblin Boss

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The goblin doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when they move through or out of an enemy’s reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Frost Goblin Boss makes two attacks with it's axe. The second attack has disadvantage. Alternatively one attack with hand axe and one command.

action.name: Hand Axe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or {@hit 5} to hit range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage in melee, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage at range.

action.name: Command
entries: The boss chooses one ally they can see within 30 feet of them. If the target can hear the boss, the target can use their reaction to move up to their speed or make one weapon attack.

reaction.name: Cowardly Commander
entries: When a creature the underboss can see hits them with an attack, the underboss chooses a willing ally within 5 feet of them. The attack hits the ally instead.

bonusHeader: Each willing ally within 30 feet of the underboss who can hear them becomes reckless until the start of the underboss's next turn. While reckless, a creature has advantage on attack rolls, and attack rolls against the creature have advantage.

monster.name: Frost Goblin Shaman

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Frost Goblin Shaman is a 5th-level spellcaster. It's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Frost Goblin Shaman has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The goblin doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage if used with both hands.

bonus.name: Aid Me!
entries: The Frost Goblin Shaman shouts for aid and {@dice 1d4} Frost Goblin Fodder appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the Frost Goblin Shaman.

reaction.name: No Dying!
entries: When an ally the Frost Goblin Shaman can see within 30 feet of her is reduced to 0 hit points, they are reduced to 1 hit point instead.

legendaryHeader: The Frost Goblin Shaman has three Villainous actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn.
They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Let No Food Escape!
entries: Each ally within 60 feet of the Frost Goblin Shaman who can hear them can move up to their speed or make a melee weapon attack (no action required).

legendary.name: Action 2: Focus Fire.
entries: The Frost Goblin Shaman chooses an enemy they can see with 60 feet of her. The Frost Goblin Shaman and each ally within 60 feet of them who can hear them can move up to their speed toward the target.

legendary.name: Action 3: Kill!.
entries: Each ally within 60 feet of the Frost Goblin Shaman who can hear her can make a weapon attack with advantage (no action required). If the attack hits, it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes one Spiked Club attack and one Fist attack.

action.name: Spiked Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the ogre can’t use this fist to attack other targets. The ogre has two fists, one of which holds their club.

action.name: People-Bowling
entries: The ogre throws one Medium or smaller creature they are grappling up to 30 feet horizontally. Each creature in the thrown creature’s path must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. After this throw, the thrown creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Bellow (1/Day)
entries: The ogre yells in the face of one creature within 10 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the ogre until the end of the ogre’s next turn. A creature who succeeds on their saving throw is immune to all ogres’ Bellow for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Violent Focus (1/Day)
entries: If the ogre takes damage while {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}, they end these conditions on themself.

trait.name: Defiant Anger
entries: When the ogre hunter has half their hit points or fewer, they are resistant to mundane bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Unimpeded
entries: The ogre hunter can occupy a {@condition prone} creature’s space. The first time the ogre hunter enters a {@condition prone} creature’s space on the ogre hunter's turn, the {@condition prone} creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. When a {@condition prone} creature in the ogre hunter's space stands up, the creature enters the nearest unoccupied space of their choice.

action.name: Great Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: People-Bowling
entries: The ogre throws one Medium or smaller creature they are grappling up to 30 feet horizontally. Each creature in the thrown creature's path must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. After this throw, the thrown creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

bonus.name: Moving through!
entries: The ogre hunter can attempt to run through a small or medium target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone} the ogre hunter gains the benefit of the disengage action.

reaction.name: Violent Focus (1/Day)
entries: If the ogre takes damage while {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}, they end these conditions on themself.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Sneak
entries: The tiger takes the Hide action.

walk.condition: (fly 40 ft., swim 30 ft. in swam form)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The swanmays's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The swanmay can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In swan form the Swanmay makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Beak (Swan form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

Swanmays are an enigmatic order of women, known for their unique ability to transform between human and swan forms. Swanmays gain their shape-shifting powers through magical tokens, often a cloak of swan feathers. These tokens are vital to their transformation, and without them, a swanmay loses her ability to change shape and becomes vulnerable, sometimes even fatally so if the cloak is destroyed. This dependency makes swanmays fiercely protective of their cloaks, and they may go to great lengths to recover them if stolen.

Swanmays are deeply connected to nature and the protection of the wilderness. They often reside in temperate wetlands or near bodies of water, where they watch over and care for local wildlife, particularly swans. Their role as guardians extends to opposing evil forces that threaten their natural environments. Although they are reclusive and prefer to remain hidden, swanmays may ally with adventurers who share their commitment to preserving nature. In combat, they employ stealth and evasion, striking from the shadows and utilizing their keen senses.

The swanmay’s magical abilities include communication with avian creatures especially swans. They are known for their enchanting presence. While they value their solitude, swanmays can be formidable allies to those who prove themselves trustworthy and dedicated to the cause of protecting the natural world.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The swanmay has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The swanmay has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The swanmay can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

bonus.name: Shapechanger
entries: The swanmay can use its action to polymorph into a giant swan. Her statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

walk.condition: (40 ft., climb 30 ft. in bear or hybrid form)

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid or into a Large bear, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The werebear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In bear form, the werebear makes two claw attacks. In humanoid form, it makes two greataxe attacks. In hybrid form, it can attack like a bear or a humanoid.

action.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Nonhuman Lycanthropes
entries: The statistics presented in this section assume a base creature of human. However, you can also use the statistics to represent nonhuman lycanthropes, adding verisimilitude by allowing a nonhuman lycanthrope to retain one or more of its humanoid racial traits. For example, an elf werewolf might have the Fey Ancestry trait.

trait.name: Dirty Fighter
entries: Once per turn, if Ranchefus makes a weapon attack with advantage, he inflicts an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage on a hit.

trait.name: Ring of Free Action
entries: While Ranchefus wears the {@item ring of free action}, difficult terrain doesn't cost him extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce his speed nor cause him to be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Cyric's Favor
entries: Ranchefus's holy symbol allows him a blessing that doubles the number of skeletons and zombies he can animate and control using the Animate Dead spell.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When the Ranchefus makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ranchefus is a 5th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ranchefus makes two {@item flail +2} attacks, or one flail attack and casts a spell.

action.name: Flail +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) damage.

action.name: Wings of Flying
entries: As an action, Ranchefus can activate the {@item wings of flying} to gain a fly speed of 60 feet. The wings stay active for one hour, after which they can't be used again for {@dice 1d12} hours.

reaction.name: Flying Retreat
entries: Ranchefus can use his reaction to Disengage and move up to his fly speed, but only if his wings of flying are active.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Swordsman makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The swordsman adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the swordsman must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day).
entries: When the bandit makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Skeleton Soldiers
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 80/320 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Skeletal Resilience
entries: Due to its lack of flesh or vital organs, the Skeleton Soldier is resistant to non-magical piercing and slashing damage, as its bones only crack under heavier impact.

monster.name: Brittle Skeleton
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword (Group Attack)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}1 Slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow (Group Attack)
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 80/320 ft. one target. {@h}1 Piercing damage. If the target is a creature and three or more skeleton minions joined the attack, the skeletons can choose another creature they can see within 5 feet of the original target. The second target takes 2 piercing damage.

trait.name: Skeletal Resilience
entries: Due to its lack of flesh or vital organs, the Skeleton Soldier is resistant to non-magical piercing and slashing damage, as its bones only crack under heavier impact.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the skeleton takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the skeleton takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lyntern makes two battleaxe or short bow attacks.

action.name: +1 Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Adventurous Spirit
entries: Lyntern Parlfray has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lyntern casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}):

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Short Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day).
entries: When the bandit makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sneak Attack.
entries: Once per turn, if the sneaky bandit makes a weapon attack with advantage or flanking, it inflicts an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage on a hit.

bonus.name: Cunning Action.
entries: May Dash, Disengage, or Hide as a bonus action.

monster.name: War Dog
languages: can understand limited commands in Common

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The war dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The war dog has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the war dog's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Spiked Armor
entries: Any creature attacked by the war dog must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage from the spikes on the armor. Additionally, any creature grappling the war dog automatically takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage at the beginning of the war dog's turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day).
entries: When the bandit makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll

trait.name: Assassinate.
entries: On his first turn, Balrat has advantage on attack rolls against any foe that hasn't taken a turn yet. Any hit scored on a {@status surprised|XPHB} foe is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack.
entries: Once per turn, if Balrat makes a weapon attack with advantage or flanking, he inflicts an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage on a hit.

bonus.name: Cunning Action.
entries: Balrat may Dash, Disengage, or Hide as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Potion of Healing (1 use).
entries: As an action, Balrat can heal 7 ({@dice 2d4 + 2}) hit points.

action.name: Scimitar +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The Wilmors deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Wilmors that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Wilmors doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Wilmors makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

bonus.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action.
entries: Wilmors may Dash, Disengage, or Hide as a bonus action.

action.name: Scimitar +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry.
entries: Wilmors adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Wilmors must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Wight
languages: the languages they knew in life

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes one Longsword attack and one Vitality Theft attack, or they make two Heavy Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Necrotic damage..

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken. Until the start of the wight's next turn, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls made against creatures other than the wight.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a Zombie under the wight's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at a time.

reaction.name: Decaying Guard
entries: When an ally the wight can see within 5 feet of them is hit by an attack, the wight forces the attacker to reroll the attack and to instead target the wight or a willing ally within 5 feet of the original target.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

monster.name: Wight, Lesser
languages: the languages they knew in life

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the siphoner takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the siphoner takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Grasping Resurrection (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 necrotic damage. If three or more siphoners joined the attack, they can restore the remains of a destroyed Undead minion within 15 feet of the target. That Undead minion returns to life with all their hit points. If five or more siphoners joined the group attack, they can either choose to increase the range of this effect from 15 to 30 feet or to restore two Undead minions instead of one.

monster.name: Cultist's Zombie
languages: Understands the languages they knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the ranchefus zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the ranchefus zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 8({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of combat, Marly has advantage on attack rolls against any {@status surprised|XPHB} creature.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Marly makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Hit 'Em Where It Hurts
entries: When Marly has advantage on a weapon attack roll or flanking, the attack deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage on a hit.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Locking Garrote
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or Small creature against which Marly must be stealthed and catch a target unaware to use this action.

On a hit, she locks the garrote around the character's neck. The character begins to choke and, after a number of rounds equal to their Constitution bonus, will drop to 0 Hit Points and start dying. Anyone can use an action to unlock the garrote and stop the choking by making a {@dc 14} Intelligence check. Rogues with the Assassin archetype add their proficiency bonus and roll with advantage. The victim can try to remove it, but rolls with disadvantage. A choking character can't be stabilized until the garrote is removed.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The rat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or contract Blood Rot. Incubation period of {@dice 1d4} days afer infection. The infected creature's constitution score decreases by 1 point each week until cured. If the target's constitution drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The carrion crawler makes nine attacks: Eight, one for each of it's tentacles and one with it's bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Wraith

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Agonizing Phasing.
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The wraith takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if they end their turn inside an object. A creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage the first time a wraith passes through them on a turn or half as much on a successful save.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Agonizing Touch.
entries: Agonizing Touch. Melee Spell Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} (save ends at end of turn).

Each time a target {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} in this way fails a saving throw to end the condition, their hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a Humanoid dies within 1 minute of being hit by this attack, their spirit rises as a {@creature specter}  under the wraith's control in an unoccupied space nearest to where that Humanoid died

reaction.name: Denied Vitality.
entries: When a creature who the wraith can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points, the wraith can attempt to sap the life energy restoring the creature. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or only regain half the number of hit points they otherwise would regain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lyntern makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

trait.name: Adventurous Spirit
entries: Lyntern Parlfray has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lyntern makes two Longsword attacks or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Adventurous Spirit
entries: Lyntern Parlfray has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

bonus.name: Second Wind
entries: The sidekick can use a bonus action on its turn to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + its level in this class. Once it uses this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can use it again.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant bombardier beetle spits acid in a line that is 15 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The giant bombardier beetle has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while in it's natural terrain.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the piercer remains motionless on the ceiling, it is indistinguishable from a normal stalactite. Granting it advantage on the Drop action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage  1d8}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Drop
entries: The piercer falls. {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, one creature directly underneath the piercer. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The piercer reduces any damage it takes from the fall by 20.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes an addition 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage at the start of the eels turn.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The eel can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The giant catfish can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Sensory Whiskers
entries: In water the giant catfish effectively has blindsight 10 ft. and can sense and attack stealthed and {@condition invisible} targets with no penalty.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled}  (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the catfish can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The giant catfish can swallow a {@condition grappled} creature, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has {@quickref Cover||3||total cover} against attacks and other effects outside the giant catfish, and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the giant catfish's turns. If the giant catfish takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the giant catfish must succeed on a {@dc 12} constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the giant catfish. If the giant catfish dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Shilek
headerEntries: Shilek casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Touch of Death (1 use, Recharges on short rest)
entries: When Shilek hits with a melee attack, she can deal 13 extra necrotic damage.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Shilek makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Levitate
entries: Shilek uses {@item boots of levitation|xdmg} to cast {@spell Levitate|xphb} on herself.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Shilek can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Bolster Necromancy (3/Day)
entries: An undead creature of Shilek choice within 60 feet of her regains 15 ({@dice 3d4 + 8}) hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Imrin casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Touch of Death (1 use, Recharges on short rest).
entries: When Imrin hits with a melee attack, she can deal 13 extra necrotic damage.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When the Imrin makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Mace +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Magical Bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Bolstering Pride.
entries: When another creature within 60 feet of Imrin who can hear and understand them makes a saving throw, Imrin can give that creature advantage on the saving throw.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Imrin can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (1/Day)
entries: When Ramor makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ramor makes two two-handed longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) Slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The swordsman adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the swordsman must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Trained Guard
entries: When an ally that Ramor can see within 5 feet of them is hit by an attack, Ramor forces the attacker to reroll the attack and to instead target Ramor.

bonus.name: Potion of Superior (1 use)
entries: You regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} Hit Points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. Deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage on a critical hit and is eligible to use Locked Jaw Thrash against the same target next round.

action.name: Locked Jaw Thrash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target previously hit by Locked Jaw Thrash or eligible critical hit . {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orog makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The orog regains 10 hit points.

bonus.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the orog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When the Bloodskull Orog isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the Bloodskull Orog drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Garundaryek is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). Garundaryek has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Garundaryek makes two claw attacks.
If she has fewer than half of its hit points remaining she can make four claw attacks.
She can forgo one attack to cast a spell.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) damage.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When Ogurkek isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Ogurkek drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ogurkek makes two great axe attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The Ogurkek regains 10 hit points.

bonus.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the Ogurkek can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

bonus.name: Sounder Leader's command
entries: When a creature Ogurkek can see within 30 feet of him fails an ability check or misses with an attack roll, that creature can reroll the check or attack, choosing either result.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Eye of Gruumsh makes two Spear attacks or one attack and one spell.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Gruumsh's Fury
entries: The orc deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

bonus.name: Rallying Chant (1/Day)
entries: The Eye of Gruumsh and up to three allies within 60 feet of them who can hear them regain 20 hit points, and these creatures ignore difficult terrain for 1 minute.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The dwarf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The battlehammer dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Warrior Sidekick (Attacker)
entries: Snagger gains a +2 bonus to all attack rolls.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Snagger's attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dwarf makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: +1 Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind
entries: Snagger can use a bonus action on its turn to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + its level in this class. Once it uses this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can use it again.

monster.name: Ice Troll

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ice troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ice troll regains 15 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the ice troll takes Acid or Fire damage, this trait doesn't function on the troll's next turn. The ice troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Bitter Cold
entries: If the target takes any cold damage from the ice trolls attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ice troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with a Rimehammer or Rhimeaxe. The ice troll will only result to using claws if unarmed.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Rimehammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. On successful hit the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rimeaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. On successful hit the ice troll can make an addition {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one additional different target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d12 }) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frozen Slime Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: The ice troll spits frozen slime at one creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) cold damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actionHeader: An Ice troll either carries a Rimehammer or Rhimeaxe.

trait.name: Relentless (1/turn)
entries: When the Bloodskull Orc isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against an enemy (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the Bloodskull Orc drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) Piercing damage. On successful hit the bloodskull orc piker can push the target up to 10 feet away if it is Large or smaller.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The Bloodskull Orc regains 5 hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Eye of Gruumsh makes two Spear attacks or one attack and one spell.

action.name: Pike +1 (Deep Whisper)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) Piercing damage.
When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with Deep Whisper, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} acid damage.

trait.name: Gruumsh's Fury
entries: The orc deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

trait.name: Fearless Aura
entries: Deep Whisper may grant any allied creatures within 100 feet of the wielder a +4 bonus to saving throws against fear and similar spells and effects.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

bonus.name: Rallying Chant (1/Day)
entries: The Eye of Gruumsh and up to three allies within 60 feet of them who can hear them regain 20 hit points, and these creatures ignore difficult terrain for 1 minute.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duskgloom myconid uses either it's Poison Spores or it's Caustic Spores, then makes a fist attack.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Spores
entries: The duskgloom myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see. {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, reach 5 ft. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The piercer reduces any damage it takes from the fall by 20.

action.name: Caustic Spores (1/Day)
entries: The duskgloom myconid releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature inside the cone must succeed on a {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}  {@actSaveFail} take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the duskgloom myconid's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Myconids are intelligent, ambulatory fungi that live in the Underdark, seek enlightenment, and deplore violence. If approached peacefully, myconids gladly provide shelter or allow safe passage through their colonies.

entries.name: Circles and Melds
entries: The largest myconid in a colony is its sovereign, which presides over one or more social groups called circles. A circle consists of twenty or more myconids that work, live, and meld together.

A meld is a form of communal meditation that allows myconids to transcend their dull subterranean existence. The myconids' rapport spores bind the participants into a group consciousness. Hallucination spores then induce a shared dream that provides entertainment and social interaction. Myconids consider melding to be the purpose of their existence. They use it in the pursuit of higher consciousness, collective union, and spiritual apotheosis. Myconids also use their rapport spores to communicate telepathically with other sentient creatures.

entries.name: Myconid Reproduction
entries: Like other fungi, myconids reproduce by mundane sporing. They carefully control their spores' release to avoid overpopulation.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duskgloom myconid uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Caustic Spores, then makes a fist attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage.

action.name: Animating Spores (3/Day)
entries: The duskgloom myconid releases spores at a Medium or Small corpse within 5 feet of it that wasn't a Construct or an Undead. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a {@creature Myconid Spore Servant|XMM}. The corpse stays animate for {@dice 1d4 + 1} weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

action.name: Caustic Spores (Recharge on 5 or 6)
entries: The duskgloom myconid releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature inside the cone must succeed on a {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}  {@actSaveFail} take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the duskgloom myconid's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Myconid sovereigns resemble towering myconid adults with elaborate fungal growths. They direct their lesser kin and see to the health and growth of vast fungal blooms.

entries.name: Myconids
entries: {@i Keepers of the Spore}

Myconids dwell in remote Underdark reaches overgrown with molds and mushrooms. These ambulatory fungal creatures tend to their sanctuaries and avoid becoming embroiled in the conflicts of other creatures. They use specialized spores to communicate, to alert one another to danger, and to defend themselves. When myconids encounter others beings, they use mind-linking spores to allow nearby creatures to telepathically share thoughts. Nevertheless, myconids' goals remain mysterious to most non-fungal creatures.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Poison damage.
Spore servants are corpses that have been overgrown and reanimated by a myconid sovereign's spores. These fungus-infested bodies are extensions of a myconid sovereign and obey its will.

entries.name: Myconids
entries: {@i Keepers of the Spore}

Myconids dwell in remote Underdark reaches overgrown with molds and mushrooms. These ambulatory fungal creatures tend to their sanctuaries and avoid becoming embroiled in the conflicts of other creatures. They use specialized spores to communicate, to alert one another to danger, and to defend themselves. When myconids encounter others beings, they use mind-linking spores to allow nearby creatures to telepathically share thoughts. Nevertheless, myconids' goals remain mysterious to most non-fungal creatures.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the Duskgloom Myconid Spore Servant dies, it explodes in a burst of poison spores. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
